review: I have to start with this preface: if you are choosing between an Apple TV, Roku, Chromecast, Amazon Fire, etc and you are already within the Apple Ecosystem, I'm 90% sure you will be most satisfied with the Apple TV.All of my electronic devices are on OS X or iOS. The Apple TV centralizes all of my devices. It connects and streams off my iTunes library and iTunes account. I use it for iTunes Radio as well, but can watch movies and listen to music straight from my computer (good thing because I'm tired of buying HDMI cables that stop working). Additionally, I love AirPlay. If I'm too lazy to go on the YouTube app or can't view something on the Apple TV (because there is not ATV app for it), then AirPlay will just throw it on the screen.That said, there are two things you should also consider that would actually make this thing useful: a good Wi-Fi connection and subscription to services like Netflix or HBO GO etc. The latter is not as important because I know a lot of people just use it to stream from their computer or use the free services that are included, but you can maximize how amazingly convenient this thing is through Netflix or HBO Go services and the like. But I can't stress the importance of Wi-Fi connection. If it's slow or unreliable, it will really diminish the enjoyment of this device.Another thing that I like? I can watch stuff on my own time and interest. I stopped watching TV years ago but I still see how people just mindlessly watch whatever is on, no choice and limited to time (even if they have DVR). Not only that, you don't have to pay $50 for like 4 channels you actually want and 600 others you don't care about. If you Netflix and other services can suffice your selection, you can either save money on entertainment subscriptions OR allocate some of those savings towards faster internet (and you'd probably still have some money left over for gas or food!).
author: Stan T.

review: As with most Apple products its very easy to use. I love being able to stream Spotify directly from any of my devices to the Apple TV that is plugged into my Yamaha surround sound via digital optical cable. There are quite a few apps on the device but ones that aren't can easily be streamed from any IOS device by clicking the airplay icon. Once ATV was plugged into my network the icon appeared on all of my devices so there was no set up involved.

review: Has similar channels as Chrome and Fire, but the plus is connecting to your iTunes library on another computer in the house.  Problem is that this connectivity is very spotty.  One day I can play movies, music, etc.  Next day I get a spinning wheel on the Apple TV that never goes away.  Fix the connectivity issue, and this will be a winner.  Otherwise, just plain frustrating.
